main_question: What are the three main groups of Aboriginal peoples?
possible_answers: A. Métis, Inuit, and United Empire Loyalists
B. Acadians, Métis, and First Nations
C. Early French settlers, Métis, and Indian
D. Métis, First Nations, and Inuit
answer: D. Métis, First Nations, and Inuit
explanatory_sentence: About 65% of the Aboriginal people are First Nations, while 30% are Métis and 4% Inuit.
